decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of board wipes like Terminus, counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell, and card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sensei's Divining Top. The deck utilizes a mix of blue and white cards to answer threats and outvalue opponents, while also having access to red for additional removal and versatile spells like Pyroblast. By controlling the game and setting up win conditions with Entreat the Angels and Jace, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in the long game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while deploying threats quickly. It uses cards like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker to apply pressure. Force of Will and Daze provide additional disruption and protection. The deck aims to control the game early with disruptive spells and quick threats, while utilizing powerful card selection and mana denial to maintain tempo.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while putting on pressure with efficient threats. The deck primarily focuses on generating card advantage through cards like Liliana of the Veil, Dark Confidant, and Hymn to Tourach, while controlling the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Wasteland. It also aims to protect its threats with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. By efficiently managing resources and applying early pressure, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Legacy 1 vs 1 environment.

This control Stoneblade deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and True-Name Nemesis to control the board. By utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull, the deck can generate incremental advantage and close out the game. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a longer game.

The main concept of this Combo - Dredge Legacy deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards using cards like Careful Study, Faithless Looting, and Breakthrough, in order to fuel powerful graveyard-based combos. The deck aims to use cards like Bridge from Below, Dread Return, and creatures like Ichorid and Golgari Grave-Troll to create a loop of powerful creatures entering and leaving the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a large number of creatures and potentially win the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and rituals, in order to cast a powerful card draw spell like Ad Nauseam or Infernal Tutor. The deck uses cards like Ponder and Preordain to help set up the combo, while disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy help to protect the combo player from their opponent's interaction. The ultimate goal is to cast Tendrils of Agony to deal a lethal amount of damage to the opponent in one turn.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to gain control of the game by utilizing counter spells, removal spells, and card filtering to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull to provide additional threats and resilience. The mana base and card selection tools like Sensei's Divining Top help ensure consistency in executing the control strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage through card filtering with Sensei's Divining Top and Brainstorm. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Counterbalance, while also having threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Vendilion Clique to pressure the opponent. The deck also has the ability to stabilize the board with Terminus and Entreat the Angels, making it difficult for the opponent to overcome its control strategies.

This deck focuses on using Cloudpost to ramp up mana quickly and efficiently in order to bring out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan, Emrakul, and Ulamog. It also utilizes cards like Show and Tell and Candelabra of Tawnos to cheat out big threats early on. The deck includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top to help find key pieces of the combo. Additionally, there are utility cards like Pithing Needle and Repeal for control and disruption. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and outvalue them in the mid to late game.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources while applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay to control the board and protect its threats. With a mix of countermagic and removal, it seeks to keep the opponent on the back foot while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The deck's mana denial strategy with Wasteland and the utility of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Brainstorm help it maintain tempo and advantage throughout the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down your opponent's plays, combined with disruptive lands like Rishadan Port and Wasteland, you aim to control the game. Meanwhile, utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to quickly close out the game with aggressive threats. The deck's goal is to efficiently disrupt and pressure your opponent, making it difficult for them to execute their game plan.

The main concept of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures such as Serra Avenger and Mirran Crusader. The deck aims to control the board through powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte, while also utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield quickly. The combination of disruption and aggression makes this deck a formidable force in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly control the board and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. Utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Lord of Atlantis to accelerate onto the battlefield, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis provides a tough-to-remove threat, while cards like Master of the Pearl Trident and Merrow Reejerey boost the power of the Merfolk creatures. With a focus on tempo and aggression, the deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The primary focus of this Merfolk deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a variety of aggressive creatures such as True-Name Nemesis, Silvergill Adept, and Lord of Atlantis. By utilizing cards like Phantasmal Image and Merrow Reejerey to support their powerful creatures, this deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Cosi's Trickster and Counterspell. Additionally, Chalice of the Void and Force of Will provide extra protection and control options to help secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, Griselbrand, and Progenitus into play as quickly as possible using cards like Show and Tell, Hypergenesis, and Violent Outburst. By using cards like Shardless Agent, Elvish Spirit Guide, and Simian Spirit Guide, along with land fetching cards, the deck aims to cast these creatures for little to no mana cost. The deck also includes cards like Omniscience and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly cheat massive creatures, such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, into play through the use of cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By using fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and lands that produce multiple mana like City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-power threats early in the game. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies.
